metadata.title: CVE-2019-15692 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
TigerVNC version prior to 1.10.1 is vulnerable to heap buffer overflow. Vulnerability could be triggered from CopyRectDecoder due to incorrect value checks. Exploitation of this vulnerability could potentially result into remote code execution. This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-15692` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tigervnc-common - 1.10.1+dfsg-1
tigervnc-scraping-server - 1.10.1+dfsg-1
tigervnc-standalone-server - 1.10.1+dfsg-1
tigervnc-viewer - 1.10.1+dfsg-1
tigervnc-xorg-extension - 1.10.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tigervnc package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.1+dfsg-1').
